intro: Gnidia kundelungensis, commonly known as the Kundelungue wild pear, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a small, rough-skinned berry that contains several seeds. Gnidia kundelungensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
